title: 820-3115 burning out HD cables
message:
[SIZE=12px][FONT=times new roman]have a mbp 13 which is going thru hd cables like crazy, to the point that I know its not the cables

brand new ones will usually work for like a week or so, and then no more
for example i just put a new cable and ssd and before i can even transfer a whole system carbon copy is giving a crap load of read errors

Has anyone seen this before?

Have you seen U5410 be bad or is it some support caps, or is that whole things with [/FONT][/SIZE]     [SIZE=12px][FONT=times new roman]L4539, SSD_OOBD2R_L and  the SATA OOB Comparator [/FONT][/SIZE]

title: 820-3115 burning out HD cables
message: No way a board can mess up a cable. First suspect would be an incompatible SSD.

title: 820-3115 burning out HD cables
message: By the way, Apple is replacing those cables for free now.

title: 820-3115 burning out HD cables
message:
I've gone thru 4 cables with the original hd, before trying the ssd

tell me i'm crazy

title: 820-3115 burning out HD cables
message: any other ideas? i was thinking maybe it was an inductor or something like when a USB is bad

title: 820-3115 burning out HD cables
message: IO errors can also be caused by bad RAM. Did you also check your HDD for bad sectors?

title: 820-3115 burning out HD cables
message: I had this, but in the reverse to you. Replaced a faulty hdd which went OK, but then it ended up coming back. The cable fried the hdd. I changed the hdd again and fitted a new cable. All good.

title: 820-3115 burning out HD cables
message:
It is an old post, but I'd like to add my experience.
I've noticed that once the SATA-HDD cable goes bad, the HDD itself is soon to follow. I always advise the customer to replace them bother together or keep his stuff backed-up. Since doing this approach had much less issues.
Also the SATA-HDD cable replacement program is not *public* and Apple will not always replace them for free like I had posted above.
Finally it seems that the HDD cable model 821-1480-A it is the faulty model and if the replacement carries the same number, it will keep failing => should be replaced by a cable having a different model number -> this is still to be confirmed. Gathering data about it now.

title: 820-3115 burning out HD cables
message: i gave up on that machine, i think i put a ssd on the optical bay
